page.title: 06FARMING..A GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: Farming dominates the economy in our local area. Overwhelmingly it is the main land user and the main employer. It is mainly mixed farming with a balance between cropping and livestock rearing.The main crops are seed and ware potatoes, winter and spring sown cereals like barley and wheat, grass for hay and silage, turnips and kale for animal feeding. The recent increase in output of oil seed rape and protein peas reflects the price squeeze facing the more traditional cereal crops. Cattle are mainly British breeds such as Hereford and Aberdeen Angus crossed with heavier continental breeds like Charolais and Simmental.Sheep are mainly Suffolk and Texel crosses.
